title: The Dance between Sacred and Secular | with Aidan Hart
description:
Aidan Hart is a writer, iconographer and liturgical designer. I’m very excited to have him on the channel as he’s been an inspiration in the world of iconography and to me personally since I started carving icons. Today we of course talk about his work, not just in iconography but also in liturgical design more generally. We also discuss the difficulty of novelty in the modern world, the artist vs the saint, the possibilities for the sacred informing the secular, dealing with ugliness in our world and future solutions to create more beauty. Enjoy.

==================

Timestamps:
00:00 Introduction
01:35 About Aidan Hart
04:19 Living as a monk
06:39 Connect Tradition with your world
13:25 Discerning images in the modern world
16:48 The artist vs the saint
24:47 The sacred as the source for the secular
29:13 Where we can bridge the gap
32:57 Going too far outside of Tradition
35:26 The effect of novelty & the internet
39:32 Harmony & designing whole spaces
45:12 Advice with ugly spaces
50:35 A focus on the future
55:09 Back to basics: the value of beauty
58:57 Outro

==================
